title: Disenchantment, Rationality, Modernity and the Church
description:
Sarah is a homeschooling mom who lives on the farm. She's been a regular on the Rando's channel and the Discord server and we sit down for our second conversation about being Christian and working in and with the church. 

A Grief Observed 2 (Randos) https://youtu.be/t0P6vb6p-eA
Sarah and Jeff (Randos) https://youtu.be/4Iiq5RihnAQ
Grief Observed 3 (Randos) https://youtu.be/WrsJInvreWs
Grief Observed 5 (Randos) https://youtu.be/NYQBj6c6W2E
Sarah and Julian (Randos) https://youtu.be/NQkDGOUbjwk
Notes
Conversations with Jeff and Julian on the Randos channel
Four points that have impacted her
Need them to be practical, we tend to live in our heads and that is futile
Re-enchantment of the world she knew as a child
Fuller integration of Christianity into all areas of life
Developing and cultivating meaning making practices
Community of people seeking truth, goodness and beauty

As a child she lived in this magical world. The world was alive. As she grew older she distanced from that reality that shaped her so vividly. Went into a period of death and numbness. 

Through church experiences was skeptical of experience itself. Involved in an unhealthy charismatic type church. People’s experiences were whatever they wanted. Drifted towards reason. Go to the Bible as center of authority. Biblical rationalism

Christianity felt more and more dead. Had a very enchanted side of her connected to poetry and music, etc. 

Church drama around Biblical interpretation. 

The role of reason has been to look back on experiences and use reason to know what experiences are in alignment with reality/truth/ etc. 

What role does reason play. 
Vervaeke


Click here to meetup with other channel viewers for conversation https://discord.gg/2uUhZBK The link will prompt you to download the software for this free group messaging service. This link updates every 100 users so look for the most recent videos if this link doesn't work.
